overview: The innocence of a home movie is called into question when consent is unexpectedly denied by the filmmakerâ€™s grandmother. In an effort to challenge our obsession with the body and the notion of the director, N/A (Not Available) asks: if consent is to be respected, how do we as both filmmakers and family members navigate and cope with the desire to capture imagery of those closest to us? -RO & MO
